intro: Saionia hyodoi, commonly known as the Japanese flame tree, is a deciduous tree native to Japan. It belongs to the Lythraceae family and is characterized by its showy, red-orange flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are ovate to elliptic in shape. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular ornamental plant. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, winged seeds.
